headline: Ghosn Flight Puts Japan On Defensive About Courts
abstract: Officials, breaking their silence, said they would tighten immigration procedures and investigate how the fallen auto executive was able to elude tight surveillance.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Japanese officials on Sunday defended the country’s justice system as fair and open and condemned Carlos Ghosn’s flight from criminal charges there, as its courts are put under a global spotlight for their treatment of suspects and a near-perfect conviction record by prosecutors.
